tasks.name: identify_business_challenges
tasks.intent: Given the company name, identify and describe the major challenges the company is facing this fiscal year.
tasks.prompt: Identify and describe the major challenges facing ${company_name} in the current fiscal year. Focus on challenges that are significantly affecting the company's core financial output. Include both company-specific challenges and broader industry-level challenges that impact the company. Ensure all information is current and verified from multiple reliable sources. Provide specific examples and data where possible to support your analysis.

company_name.description: The name of the company to analyze for major challenges.

company_challenge_1.description: Description of a major company-specific challenge facing the company this fiscal year.

company_challenge_2.description: Description of another major company-specific challenge facing the company this fiscal year.

company_challenge_3.description: Description of a third major company-specific challenge facing the company this fiscal year.

industry_challenge_1.description: Description of a major industry-level challenge affecting the company this fiscal year.

industry_challenge_2.description: Description of another major industry-level challenge affecting the company this fiscal year.

financial_impact.description: Overview of how these challenges are affecting the company's core financial output.

reasoning.description: Explanation of the analysis and why these challenges are considered major for the company.

citations.description: URLs separated by space which support the information provided. E.g. http://example.com/1 http://example.com/2

tasks.name: kyb_verification
tasks.intent: Given the company name, domain, and country, verify the company's existence and legitimacy through an extensive Know Your Business (KYB) analysis.
tasks.prompt:
Conduct a comprehensive Know Your Business (KYB) verification and risk assessment for the given company.

Company: ${company_name}
Claimed Domain: ${domain}
Country: ${country}

Verification Steps:
1. Verify company existence and legitimacy:
   - Confirm registration/incorporation status
   - Verify operating history
   - Check for legitimate business operations

2. Domain verification:
   - Verify domain ownership matches company
   - Check domain age and registration details
   - Look for any suspicious domain patterns

3. Risk Assessment:
   Check for risk signals including but not limited to:
   - Regulatory compliance issues
   - Legal troubles or lawsuits
   - Negative news coverage
   - Suspicious business practices
   - Shell company indicators
   - Sanctioned individuals in leadership
   - Geographic risk factors
   - Cryptocurrency/blockchain involvement
   - Known scam reports or complaints

4. Evidence Collection:
   - Gather supporting URLs and sources
   - Document key findings
   - Note any verification limitations

Provide a detailed assessment with confidence score and reasoning.

company_name.title: Company Name
company_name.description: Name of the company to verify

country.title: Country
country.description: Country where company claims to operate

company_verified.title: Company Verified
company_verified.description: Whether the company exists and is legitimate

domain_verified.title: Domain Verified
domain_verified.description: Whether the domain belongs to the company

evidence.title: Evidence
evidence.description: URLs and sources supporting the findings

tasks.name: calculate_engineering_experience
tasks.intent: Given a LinkedIn profile URL, find the total number of years of professional engineering experience
tasks.prompt: Extract the work experience from the provided LinkedIn profile, calculate the total number of years the person has worked in roles that include the title 'Engineer,' excluding any roles labeled as 'Internship' or 'Co-op.' Provide the total number of years of professional engineering experience, rounded to the nearest whole number and nothing else.

linkedin_profile_url.description: The URL of the LinkedIn profile to analyze.

years_of_engineering_experience.description: The total number of years of professional engineering experience, rounded to the nearest whole number.

citations.description: URLs separated by space which support the answer. E.g. http://example.com/1 http://example.com/2

tasks.name: board_memberships
tasks.intent: Given a person's full name, job title, and current company, find their current and prior board memberships.

tasks.name: find_sourcing_site
tasks.intent: Given a government entity, find their purchasing/procurement/RFP pages.
tasks.prompt:
Given a government entity, find their purchasing/procurement/RFP pages. Please return only pages that have lists of open bids/RFPs on them instead of any general purchasing information sites.

Government Entity: ${GovernmentEntity}

Please provide:

1. All relevant URLs where they post purchasing opportunities3
2. Any special notes about their purchasing sites (e.g. if they have multiple sites that are synced, or sites that may be irrelevant)
3. If from your research, this entity is covered by another entity, please provide the name of the entity that covers instead of a purchasing site.

Ensure all URLs are active and lead directly to pages listing RFPs/opportunities/solicitations.

GovernmentEntity.description: A US state, county, city, town, or special district.

urls.description: The URLs of the purchasing sites for the given government entity, specifically the ones with lists of RFPs, RFIs, etc.

notes.description: Any special notes about the purchasing site (e.g. if they have multiple that are synced up, or ones that may be irrelevant)

items.description: Excerpts from the sources which support the answer. Ideally 2-3 sentences taken verbatim from the content

sources.description: Sources with excerpts which support the answer

covered_by_other_entity.description: If from your research, this entity is covered by another entity, please provide the name of the entity that covers it. Otherwise, leave blank.

tasks.name: identify_recent_acquisitions
tasks.intent: Given a company name, describe acquisitions they have been involved in in the last 5 years.
tasks.prompt:
Research and identify whether the given company has been involved in any acquisitions (either as acquirer or target) within the last 5 years. For each transaction found (up to 3 most recent), provide detailed information about the deal.

Company: ${company_name}

For each transaction, determine:
1. Transaction type (Acquisition, Merger, etc.)
2. Target company
3. Deal value (if disclosed)
4. Deal multiple (if available)
5. Strategic rationale

Provide detailed reasoning and citations to support findings.

company_name.description: Name of the company to research

transaction_1_type.description: Type of the first transaction (e.g., Acquisition, Merger)

transaction_1_target.description: Name of the target company in first transaction

transaction_2_target.description: Name of the target company in second transaction

transaction_3_target.description: Name of the target company in third transaction

reasoning.description: Detailed explanation of findings and analysis

citations.description: Sources used to verify the information

tasks.name: identify_industry_news
tasks.intent: Given a company name, find the latest news and insights relating to their industry
tasks.prompt:
Find the latest news and insights relating to the industry of ${company_name} that could impact their market. Focus on news that doesn't directly mention the company but is relevant to their industry. Provide the article titles, summaries, and explain their relevance to the company's business.

For each news item:
1. Provide the article title and publication date
2. Summarize the key points
3. Explain why it's relevant to the company
4. Include citation links

Focus on the 3 most relevant and recent news items.

company_name.description: Name of the company to research industry news for

company_website.description: Website of the company to help determine industry focus

article_titles.description: Titles of the news articles found. Use <UNKNOWN> if a value could not be found.

article_summaries.description: Summaries of the news articles. Use <UNKNOWN> if a value could not be found.

publication_dates.description: Publication dates of the news articles. Use <UNKNOWN> if a value could not be found.

relevance_explanations.description: Explanation of why each article is relevant to the company. Use <UNKNOWN> if a value could not be found.

citations.description: URLs separated by space which support the answer. E.g. http://example.com/1 http://example.com/2

reasoning.description: The reasoning/explanation for why these articles were selected as most relevant.

tasks.name: identify_political_organization
tasks.intent: Given a company URL and product description, check if the company is a political organization.
tasks.prompt: Analyze the provided company URL and product description to determine if the user is a political organization. Focus on any information that suggests the organization is primarily involved in accepting contributions or making expenditures for political purposes, or influencing elections or appointments to public offices. Provide your answer in the specified format, including the question, your reasoning, and a yes/no answer.

company_url.description: The URL of the company to analyze.

product_description.description: The product description of the company to analyze.

is_political_organization.description: Whether the organization is a political organization.

citations.description: URLs separated by space which support the answer. E.g. http://example.com/1 http://example.com/2

tasks.name: identify_company_relationships
tasks.intent: Given a company website, determine its parent company (if any) and its child companies. If no parent company exists, treat the given company as the parent.
tasks.prompt: Given a company website, determine its parent company (if any) and its child companies. If no parent company exists, treat the given company as the parent. Provide the parent company's name and domain, and a list of child companies.

company_website.description: The website of the company to research.

parent_company_name.description: The name of the parent company. If the input company has no parent, this will be the name of the input company.

parent_company_domain.description: The domain name of the parent company. If the input company has no parent, this will be the domain of the input company.

child_companies.description: A list of child companies associated with the parent company.

citations.description: A comma-separated list of URLs used as citations.

tasks.name: classify_website_status
tasks.intent: Given a domain, verify its status and classify it as 404, redirect, parked, valid or invalid
tasks.prompt:
Verify the validity of the given domain and classify its status based on the following criteria:

- 'Valid Domain': The page loads normally with genuine content.
- '404 Error': The domain returns a '404 Not Found' error.
- 'Parked Domain': The domain redirects to a generic hosting provider page or shows content indicating it's 'For Sale' or 'Parked'.
- 'Redirect': The domain redirects to a non-generic hosting provider and it's a valid business website. Return the website it redirects to.
- 'Invalid': The input is not a properly formatted domain (e.g., email addresses, Google Maps links).

domain.description: The domain to verify and classify.

status.description: The classification of the domain's status.

redirect_url.description: The URL the domain redirects to, if applicable.

reasoning.description: Explanation of why the domain was classified as such.

citations.description: Citations to the sources of the information.
